We are the first Dr. Sebi Vegan Cafe in Africa and the entire Earth, bringing health and wellness to Lalibela, Ethiopia. Our Host Erin is from America, and our Chef Feq'ad from Jamaica. We serve all types of international vegan based cuisines (Jamaican, American, Indian, Asian, Ethiopian etc.), with vegetarian options. We create fusions, and add our own unique twist to all of our menu items. We love to meet and serve all kinds of people delicious exotic vegan food. All of our food is prepared fresh with herbs and some greens from our garden paradise. The atmosphere is one of good vibes and relaxation, with reggae, amhara, indian, or other music playing in the background. Our Chef has a mastery over spices that will leave your taste buds wanting more. *RESERVATIONS PREFERRED*

Restaurant: Alem Cooking Class Bar and Restaurant
original_location: ['Africa', 'Ethiopia', 'Amhara Region', 'Lalibela', 'Lalibela Restaurants', 'Alem Cooking Class Bar and Restaurant']
address: Near to Jerusalem Hotel, Lalibela Ethiopia

about: Our spacious bar and restaurant prides itself on providing quality food in a clean and delightful atmosphere. Our guests' comfort and satisfaction is of upmost important to us, and we strive to provide the best quality possible and are always looking for improvements. Our talented chef uses the finest ingredients available to prepare all of our food, and every bartender and server is dedicated to providing swift service without sacrificing quality. Traditional Ethiopian food as well as a variety of international dishes are available at all times and are prepared by a highly-trained staff. According to the season and availability of ingredients, our menu changes slightly throughout the year. Guests can enjoy meals inside our roomy restaurant or choose to eat outside on our rooftop terrace. After dinner, relax and enjoy a wide selection of drinks from the main bar and marvel at the landscapes surrounding the hotel. Every night we have a small bonfire on our rooftop terrace and offer a complimentary coffee ceremony and 'tej,' Ethiopia's famous honey-wine. The coffee ceremony is one of Ethiopia's proudest traditions and we encourage all guests to participate. The inspiration for our restaurant stems from local traditions steeped in history and reverence; namely, hospitality. Guests will quickly learn that the people of Lalibela take traditions seriously, and when it comes to playing host, our commitment cannot be underestimated. Because of this, we have decided that breakfast will be complimentary for all of our guests!
